page.title: 15THE VILLAGE OF HOYLANDSWAINE
page.content: {Hoylandswaine}is 800 feet above sea level. It is a quiet village with only one shop and a post office. It has a chapel, a church and a school. The school is a small one, there are only about 56 children in it. There are 3 classes. The nearest town is { {Penistone,}which is about 3 miles to } the west. The next nearest town is { {Barnsley}which is about 6 miles to the east. {Penistone}is quite a busy town. People go there to do their shopping. There are two public houses in { {Hoylandswaine,}the Lord Nelson and the Rose and Crown. There are five farms in the village and the main occupation is {agriculture.}The farms are called Greenside, Pinfold, Hungerhill,Hill top and Greenbottom. People in the village travel to work in { {Stocksbridge, Wakefield, Sheffield, {Barnsley and Leeds.}
